basics.name: Ollin D. Langle-Chimal
basics.label: Postdoctoral Researcher in Computational Social Science
basics.summary: Postdoctoral researcher specializing in computational social science, human mobility patterns, and data science for humanitarian response. PhD in Complex Systems and Data Science with extensive experience in machine learning, network analysis, and development economics. Passionate about using data science to address social and environmental challenges.

work.summary: Research on mobility trends, employment choice modeling, and economic complexity in urban systems
highlights: Research on mobility trends by employment status in Low and Medium income countries
Research on employment choice as a Random Utility Model based on commuting patterns
Research on economic complexity at the sub-city level using urban flows
Fine-grain estimation of the informal labor force using surveys and census

work.summary: Development of disease surveillance tools and machine learning for clinical assessments
highlights: Development of disease and symptoms surveillance tools
Development of machine learning based clinical logic for disease assessments
Inference and anomaly detection using electronic health records in low and middle income countries
Data engineering and quality control

work.summary: Geospatial analysis and mobility pattern research during COVID-19
highlights: Geospatial analysis and dashboard design of GPS data and expenditure
Understanding gaps in mobility reduction and economical activity patterns
Analysis of different socioeconomic groups during the pandemic

work.summary: PhD research on human behavior modeling and decision making analysis
highlights: Gamification for decision making analysis
Analysis and modeling of human behavior under events of distress
Text classification for expressed needs during humanitarian crises
Analysis of temporal correlations in human migration patterns

work.summary: Machine Learning for public policy and social program analysis
highlights: Income estimation using machine learning
Automated analysis and detection of misreporting in surveys
Development of tools for detection of irregularities in social programs
Built unified PostgreSQL database for all social programs
Developed R package for database access

work.summary: Machine Learning for reputation management and social media analysis
highlights: Built reputation management tool for social media
Deep learning for oil leak detection
Natural Language Processing for social media monitoring

work.summary: Complex Systems research on urban perception and social media analysis
highlights: Social media mining and analysis
Built geospatial database for urban research
Analysis of urban perception through social media
Correlation analysis between caloric intake and social media usage

volunteer.organization: SACNAS (Society for Advancement of Chicanos/Hispanics and Native Americans in Science)
volunteer.summary: UVM chapter leadership and advocacy for underrepresented scientists
Latin America and the Caribbean Working Group
Research on optimal percolation and community detection in genomic networks

education.summary: Advisor: Nicholas Cheney. Gund Institute Graduate Fellow. Thesis: Data Science and Mathematical Modeling for Humanitarian Response
Advisor: Carlos Fernando Esponda Darlington. Thesis: Non-backtracking spectral algorithm for community detection on weighted networks. Graduated with Honors.
Advisor: Jesús Espinal Enriquez. Thesis: Optimal percolation on complex networks.

publications.name: Socioeconomic disparities in mobility behavior during the COVID-19 pandemic in developing countries
publications.summary: First author publication on mobility patterns during COVID-19

publications.name: Improving Real-Time Malaria Diagnosis on Site: Transforming Malaria Detection with Machine Learning
publications.summary: Machine learning approaches for malaria detection in clinical settings

publications.name: Unmet needs and behaviour during the Ebola response in Sierra Leone
publications.summary: Co-author on retrospective analysis of community feedback during Ebola outbreak

publications.name: Using experimental gaming simulations to elicit risk mitigation behavioral strategies
publications.summary: Co-author on experimental gaming for agricultural disease management

references.name: Nicholas Cheney
references.reference: PhD advisor and research mentor at University of Vermont. Expert in complex systems and computational approaches to understanding behavior.

references.name: Marta C. Gonzalez
references.reference: Current postdoctoral advisor at UC Berkeley. Leading researcher in human mobility and urban systems.
